Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse with small white shelly inclusions and partially red and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393293) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393293)
